reviews.review_msg:
NUSC 344 + 346

If you have not gotten Starosted, you did not get the true NUSC experience. Very inspirational and caring professor though. Class is very tough but is very satisfying when you realize what's actually happening. :D

*review for Fall 2020* Endless slides of equations with little accompanying explanation. Difficult exams. CHEM260 is never going to be easy, but Dr. Starosta made it more confusing than it needed to be. Also routinely went over time with his recorded lectures (online semester) and was blatantly rude to students in office hours.

Dr. Starosta has grown to be a mentor and friend. He was by far the most caring professor, spending hours cultivating and nurturing interest in students and providing guidance for careers and future pursuits.
He is the best prof I've ever had. Always reply back to the emails quickly. The class was very heavy, but he was always available to help.

Oh boy is this a hard class but I love Dr. Starosta. He is a real gem and really takes the time to explain the material and answer questions. Hes very passionate about the subject and teaching. But be ready for the workload: its equivalent to taking 3 classes its brutal. Also try having ur math credits done before taking this class.

Lecture material was quite interesting and informative. Having some examples would be nice tho. Wording of the HW can be a little vague at times. Exams are quite difficult as they require a very fluent understanding of the material. Quite willing to help you in the class and very passionate about teaching. I have to say MATH 251 should be a pre-req
Whatever you do just look at the slides. His lectures are useless

Do not start HW the night before or you'll stay up until 3am. He kinda overestimated how smart we were. Can be pretty funny in lecture but also completely burn you for getting something wrong (ahem - 1D potential well degeneracy - ahem). His lectures were a lot more involved than txtbook so pay attention. Overall a nice guy but a tough class.

Funny guy but low tolerance for stupidity and he isn't afraid to call you out on it. This is known as getting sta-roasted. Otherwise clear lectures and wants you to be smart so you can do something great someday. HW takes 20/hours a week. Midterms Q's hard to predict. Clear organization of files. Lectures are like 40 slides long. Hard class.

Starosta is a nice guy and is very smart but can't explain very well to the dumber students in class. I did not pass his class because I just couldn't grasp the concepts he was teaching despite going to every lecture, attending office hours and even doing the extra credit take-home midterms he offers for a chance to boost midterm grades by 30%

Kris is a great professor. He genuinely cares about his students and wants to make sure all of them end up understanding the material. He has a unique sense of dark humor, and loves the Boltzmann distribution. His lectures are engaging, and the homework problems prepares you for the exams well. The exam questions are fair, but not very easy.

Dr. Starosta without a doubt cares more about helping students reach their potential more so than any other prof I have encountered, if you are willing to put in the work. While courses can be very challenging,  they are designed to utilize critical thinking more so than any other class I have taken

He is a very good prof, but the courses he teaches are very difficult.  His tests are insanely difficult, and are definitely not meant to be finished in the time frame given.  However, you do walk away from his classes having learnt something, and he can be a pretty funny guy. Very accessible in office hours
